body: If you take a look at http://spack.readthedocs.io/en/latest/packaging_guide.html#fetching-from-code-repositories, you'll see that for Git we walk through a long list of options for fetching from Git repositories, some of which are "trusted" and some of which are "untrusted". But for Mercurial and Subversion, all options are "untrusted, and not recommended". If none of the options for fetching from Mercurial and Subversion repositories are recommended, what are packagers supposed to do? Is there really no way to fetch from these repositories using a hash or checksum?
title: No trusted download methods for hg or svn
